recipes.name: Salmon Sushi
recipes.info: Contrary to popular belief, salmon sushi does not originate from Japan. Prior to the 1990s, salmon was a fish only used in cheap Japanese meals, and was never eaten raw due to fear of infections from parasites. Only after a project by the Norwegians – who were commercial salmon farming and needed customers – did raw salmon start to catch on in Japan.

recipes.name: Pho
recipes.info: Pho was invented in Vietnam, in the early 20th Century, during French colonial times. Its origin is likely to be a mix of a French beef and vegetable stew (pot-au-feu), as well as Chinese beef with noodles (牛肉粉). Today, it is Vietnam’s national dish.

recipes.name: Carbonara
recipes.info: Carbonara was invented as a celebration of a town’s freedom. In attendance of the banquet were many in power, however there were few ingredients available – mosty army rations, barely any fresh produce, and just a bit of meat. Wanting to fuse Italian and Anglo-Saxon cuisine, carbonara alla spaghetti was created.
